intro: Asyneuma limonifolium f. heterophyllum, commonly known as the yellow-flowered asyneuma, is a variant of the species native to South America. It is characterized by its distinct yellow flowers and variegated foliage, which set it apart from the typical green leaves of the species. The plant belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Its unique foliage and vibrant blooms make it a desirable addition to botanical collections.
